column4: why does "sudo chown myusrname:myursname" result with "operation not permitted???
you might not be in the sudo group or it might not be configured to allow you
you have to add a file or directory name to the end of your command
right, but it says operation not permitted
is this a FAT filesystem per chance?
use the "mount" command without any arguments to find out
fat filesystems don't support user names
then how do i gain write access
there are options for mounting vfat partitions under a certain user/group
alternatively, you could set the "user,noauto" option for your filesystem in /etc/fstab and then mount it as the desired user

when mounting it, use the flag "-o uid=myuser,gid=myuser"
